title: 110_s2476
content: The "Improved Vaccine Supply Act" is cited as the short title. It amends the Public Health Service Act to include a new section on adequate vaccine supply. The Secretary will develop a plan for purchasing and storing a supply of vaccines for children and adults to last for 6 months. The Secretary will supply vaccines recommended for children and adults by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, as well as other designated vaccines for public health preparedness efforts. The Secretary will submit a plan within 6 months of enactment, utilizing specific authorities for vaccine distribution outlined in the Social Security Act and other relevant legislation. The Secretary will submit a plan to relevant Senate and House committees, including considerations for vaccine purchasing prioritization, by September 30. The Secretary must fully implement the plan by September 30, 2008. Manufacturers must provide at least 1 year notice to the Secretary before discontinuing vaccine production. Manufacturers must provide notice to the Secretary before discontinuing vaccine production, with the option to reduce the notification period under certain conditions. Proceeds from vaccine sales will be used to purchase additional vaccines, and ongoing reports are required. The Secretary must submit ongoing reports detailing progress and any impediments in implementing the plan developed under subsection (a) to the identified Committees. The Secretary must submit reports recommending whether to extend vaccine supply beyond 6 months and discussing the reasons for the recommendation. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2008 through 2012.
